page.title: 06Edward James College
page.content: The site of the College was built in 1622.The House is one of the largest flint and stone buildings in England. The college today still has most of its original furniture.New beds have been added to accomodate eighty-five residential students.Courses consist of book-binding,paper-making and calligraphy,as well as weaving and the designing and printing of textiles. Extra bathrooms have been added and the stables have been converted to garages.The yard has been changed into workshops for crafts,such as silversmithing,enamelling,jewellery-m aking and glass-engraving.The college aims to provide training courses in the visual arts,as well as high-level craftsmanship.The Morning Room and Dining are largely untouched,and the Boudoir still has much of its original furniture.
